answers.answer: This is really a question for your doctor/specialist.  Keep us posted on what you find out.

question: My doctor recommended a depo shot to help regulate my blood sugars after it was determined during my first pregnancy that my BG was very sensitive to fluctuations in hormone levels.  It TOTALLY didn't work.  I've only taken one shot but I was wondering what I should expect as far as BG fluctuations after coming off this shot.  I was strongly cautioned after having my first child not to try again because there was a strong chance that I would have a lethal low BG.  Is that a concern coming off this shot too?  I'm worried about hormone changes coming off this shot after reading some of the difficult stories posted on here.
title: Diabetes and Depo
